timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

timeline.bodyText: This should be clear that past and future are determined by the system clock on the worker machine (can we just call that "processing time"?)
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

timeline.bodyText: It would be good to add a test to verify PeriodicImpulse delays elements with timestamps in the future. One way could be to just set a startTime far in the future and verify nothing is output after some delay. But then the delay would have to be long enough to make sure the pipeline actually started for every runner, which isn't ideal.
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText: This is a valid comment. The problem is that to generate reliable test, we need to mock time on many layers. I didn't find a reliable way to do this. This test is a balance that tests most of functionality. Delaying elements to the future will make tests unreasonably long and will most likely be unreliable.
replies.author: Ardagan

timeline.bodyText: It would be a lot easier to verify many different situations if there were some way to mock the clock, but that's pretty challenging when the clock might be on a remote worker. Have we solved that problem anywhere else?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText: On the DirectRunner at least you could use DateTimeUtils#setCurrentMillisFixed
replies.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText:
I was looking to do this. Mostly looking towards TestStream, but the issue is that there's no way to get runner time within process method and I have to rely on now() to figure out how many elements I can output.
Current test is a balance that still verifies functionality, but doesn't make test run too long.
replies.author: Ardagan

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure I understand what this means, could you clarify? It looks like maybe it's re-stating the previous paragraph in a different way?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

timeline.bodyText: Does this need to be public? If so, should it have a test as well?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

timeline.message:
Add PeriodicSequence generator.
Add java snippet for slowly updating side inputs.

timeline.bodyText:
Can you add a comment here that the reason you put the Instant into a KV is so you can verify the timestamp? It took me a while to realize that.
(Also if we don't already have some general purpose way to verify timestamps in PCollections maybe we should?)
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/sdks/java/core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/PeriodicSequenceTest.java b/sdks/java/core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/PeriodicSequenceTest.java
index e3d70fea53..cd6bc01d95 100644
--- a/sdks/java/core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/PeriodicSequenceTest.java
+++ b/sdks/java/core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/PeriodicSequenceTest.java

@@ -66,7 +66,7 @@ public class PeriodicSequenceTest {
                 Create.<PeriodicSequence.SequenceDefinition>of(
                     new PeriodicSequence.SequenceDefinition(startTime, stopTime, interval)))
             .apply(PeriodicSequence.create())
-            .apply(ParDo.of(new ExtractTsDoFn<>()));
+            .apply(ParDo.of(new ExtractTsDoFn<>())); // used to validate timestamp
 
     ArrayList<KV<Instant, Instant>> expectedResults =
         new ArrayList<>((int) (duration / intervalMillis + 1));

timeline.bodyText: nit: Consider using AutoValue (and AutoValueSchemaProvider if you use schemas) so you don't have to implement these. Up to you though.
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText: I tried to use it, but didn't manage to get AutoValue work. It failed to properly detect constructor for generated class. I tried to debug it, but it would be better to handle in separate PR.
replies.author: Ardagan

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/PeriodicSequence.java b/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/PeriodicSequence.java index b9ab753784..bcf1b57241 100644 --- a/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/PeriodicSequence.java +++ b/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/PeriodicSequence.java @@ -36,13 +36,11 @@ import org.joda.time.Instant; /** * A {@link PTransform} which generates a sequence of timestamped elements at given runtime - * interval. + * intervals. * - *

Transform will not output elements prior to target time. Transform can output elements at any - * time after target time. - * - *

Multiple elements can be output at given moment if their timestamp is earlier than current - * time. + *

Transform assigns each element some timestamp and will only output element when worker clock + * reach given timestamp. Transform will not output elements prior to target time. Transform can + * output elements at any time after target time. */ @Experimental(Experimental.Kind.SPLITTABLE_DO_FN) public class PeriodicSequence

timeline.bodyText:
We really should have support for Duration in beam schemas... filed BEAM-9859 for this.
In the meantime, couldn't you just use @DefaultCoder(SerializableCoder.class) so you could store this as a Duration?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/PeriodicSequence.java b/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/PeriodicSequence.java index b9ab753784..bcf1b57241 100644 --- a/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/PeriodicSequence.java +++ b/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/PeriodicSequence.java @@ -36,13 +36,11 @@ import org.joda.time.Instant; /** * A {@link PTransform} which generates a sequence of timestamped elements at given runtime - * interval. + * intervals. * - *

Transform will not output elements prior to target time. Transform can output elements at any - * time after target time. - * - *

Multiple elements can be output at given moment if their timestamp is earlier than current - * time. + *

Transform assigns each element some timestamp and will only output element when worker clock + * reach given timestamp. Transform will not output elements prior to target time. Transform can + * output elements at any time after target time. */ @Experimental(Experimental.Kind.SPLITTABLE_DO_FN) public class PeriodicSequence

timeline.bodyText: Can you add a note that this is according to the clock on the worker node?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

timeline.bodyText: Sorry just noticed this. Can you replace it with a log statement?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit
